summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a court-ordered declaration to explain disparities in discovery and counsel access between Ghislaine Maxwell (detained at MDC) and Justin Rivera (detained at MCC). The emails detail the differences in their housing situations and the resulting accommodations, and they coordinate the drafting of a formal response to Judge Engelmayer.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in a high-profile sex trafficking case, detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in protective custody, receiving extensive accommodations for discovery review and attorney visits.

persons.name: Justin Rivera
persons.context: A defendant charged in February 2019 with sex trafficking conspiracy, detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in general population, whose counsel raised concerns about disparities in access compared to Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: The judge presiding over United States v. Rivera et al., who requested a declaration from the BOP to explain the differing accommodations provided to Maxwell and Rivera, citing concerns about the disparity's optics.

connections.description: Both are federal detainees in SDNY cases whose access to discovery and counsel accommodations are being compared by the court, with Maxwell receiving more favorable conditions.
Judge Engelmayer is presiding over Rivera's case and has expressed frustration with the MCC's treatment of Rivera, leading to orders for improved access.

events.title: Declaration Deadline on Access Disparities
events.description: Deadline for the U.S. Attorney's Office to submit a declaration to Judge Engelmayer explaining the rationale for differing discovery and counsel access accommodations between Ghislaine Maxwell and Justin Rivera.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Justin Rivera
events.description: The expected start date for Justin Rivera's trial on sex trafficking conspiracy charges, as mentioned in the email.

events.title: New Counsel Appointed for Justin Rivera
events.description: Justin Rivera had new counsel appointed due to an irreconcilable breakdown with his former counsel.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was housed in protective custody at MDC with sole access to a room for approximately 13 hours daily for computer/phone use, while Justin Rivera was in general population at MCC sharing facilities with about 80 other inmates.
The Maxwell case involved 'multiple times more discovery' than the Rivera case, justifying greater need for expanded electronic access.
Judge Engelmayer described the disparity in accommodations between Maxwell and Rivera as 'strikingly different' with 'terrible' optics and requested a formal explanation from the BOP.
By late December 2020, the MCC began leaving a laptop with Rivera all day for charging only at night, effectively matching Maxwell's electronic discovery access at MDC.
Defense counsel for Rivera suggested the differing treatment might be due to race, gender, and class, prompting judicial scrutiny.
